title: Colinas Esporte Clube
text:
Colinas Esporte Clube, commonly known as Colinas, is a Brazilian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Colinas%20do%20Tocantins">Colinas do Tocantins</a>, <a href="Tocantins">Tocantins state</a>. They won the <a href="Campeonato%20Tocantinense">Campeonato Tocantinense</a> once and competed once in the <a href="Copa%20do%20Brasil">Copa do Brasil</a>.
History.
The club was founded on January 5, 2001. They won the <a href="Campeonato%20Tocantinense">Campeonato Tocantinense</a> in 2005. Colinas competed in the <a href="Copa%20do%20Brasil">Copa do Brasil</a> in <a href="2006%20Copa%20do%20Brasil">2006</a> when they were eliminated in the First Round by <a href="Paysandu%20Sport%20Club">Paysandu</a>.
Stadium.
Colinas Esporte Clube play their home games at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20Jos%C3%A9%20Wilson%20Alves%20Ferreira">Estádio José Wilson Alves Ferreira</a>, nicknamed "Bigodão". The stadium has a maximum capacity of 1,200 people.
